```{r functions}
library(dplyr)
library(rlang)
library(fgeo)
```

```{r prefill-arguments}
# Partially fill arguments with specific details for forestgeo.
relevant_columns <- function() c("alias", "topic", "title")
fgeo_url <- "https://forestgeo.github.io/"
pick_fgeo_package <- function(x, cols, url) {
  fgeo:::pick_package(x, cols = relevant_columns(), url = fgeo_url) %>% 
    mutate(alias = fgeo:::strip_s3class(.data$alias))
}
pick_fgeo_concept <- function(x) {
  fgeo:::pick_concept(x, cols = relevant_columns(), url = fgeo_url) %>% 
    mutate(alias = fgeo:::strip_s3class(.data$alias))
}
```

```{r datatable}
custom_datatable <- function(x) {
  DT::datatable(
    x, 
    escape = FALSE, 
    rownames = NULL,
    # colnames = NULL,
    options = list(
      # f: filtering, t: table, i: information
      dom =  'fti',
      lengthChange = FALSE,
      paging = FALSE,
      pageLength = nrow(x)
    )
  )
}
```

### Help

```{r}
pick_fgeo_concept("functions to explore fgeo") %>% 
  custom_datatable()
```

### Abundance

```{r}
pick_fgeo_concept("functions for abundance and basal area") %>% 
  custom_datatable()
```

### Datasets

```{r}
all_datasets <- suppressWarnings(
  dplyr::bind_rows(
    pick_fgeo_package("fgeo.x"), 
    pick_fgeo_concept("datasets")
  )
)
all_datasets %>% 
  custom_datatable()
```
